metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1943 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The destroy_one_secret function in nm-setting-vpn.c in libnm-util in the NetworkManager package 0.8.999-3.git20110526 in Fedora 15 creates a log entry containing a certificate password, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading a log file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 0.9.4.0-0ubuntu3
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 0.9.4.0-0ubuntu3
libnm-glib4 - 0.9.4.0-0ubuntu3
libnm-util2 - 0.9.4.0-0ubuntu3
network-manager - 0.9.4.0-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> according to debian, affects network-manager, not network-manager-openvpn

criterions.comment: network-manager package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.4.0-0ubuntu3').
